subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 RFE: ignoring a test at runtime

messageBody:
On 9/23/05, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
> In JUnit 4 we can annotate a test as @Ignore. However that's only good
> at compile time. What I want is an ignore() or skip() method similar to
> the fail() method. However this method signals that a test was skipped
> instead of failed. Is there such a method already? If not, could we have
> one please? I looked but I couldn't find one in the current code base,
> but then I just wasn't looking in the right place.

I've got a more general request that solves this one as well... can we
make sure that the annotations are only used as a source of
configuration data for a programmable API? This would mean we can
change the configuration mechanism as needed.

(And, yes, Cedric... I know you can do it in TestNG. I can do it in
JUnit 3 as well - I just want to make sure I can _still_ do it in
JUnit 4)
